skill.name: vue-best-practices
skill.description: Guides Vue 3 Composition API, <script setup>, and TypeScript best practices with SSR and render function guidance for Vue projects.
skill.summary: Vue 3 best practices for Composition API, SSR, and TypeScript.
skill.author: vuejs-ai

security_audit.summary: Static findings point to code snippets in Markdown reference files, not executable logic. No prompt injection attempts were found in reviewed documentation, and no evidence of malicious behavior was identified.

low_findings.title: Documentation examples flagged as shell execution
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.3. Confidence reasoning: The matches appear in Markdown examples, not in executable code or scripts.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URLs in documentation
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.25. Confidence reasoning: URLs are shown for documentation context and do not indicate runtime network access.

low_findings.title: Weak cryptography keyword in documentation
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. Confidence: 0.35. Confidence reasoning: The keyword is in documentation content and does not represent implemented cryptography.

content.value_statement: Vue projects often suffer from reactivity bugs and inconsistent patterns. This skill provides Vue 3 Composition API, SSR, and TypeScript guidance with concrete do and do not examples.
actual_capabilities: Recommends Composition API patterns for refs, computed, and watchers in Vue 3.
Guides template structure decisions such as v-for keys and v-if separation.
Explains SSR-safe usage patterns for platform-specific APIs.
Provides render function guidance when templates are insufficient.
Outlines TypeScript prop, emit, and slot typing practices for Vue SFCs.
limitations: Does not execute code or run project builds.
Does not replace project-specific style guides or lint rules.
Does not cover Vue 2 Options API unless explicitly requested.
Does not install dependencies or configure tooling automatically.

use_cases.title: Refactor a Vue 3 component
use_cases.description: Identify Composition API and template issues before a refactor.

use_cases.title: Review team code for consistency
use_cases.description: Check for common Vue 3 anti patterns and enforce best practices.

use_cases.title: Create internal Vue guidance
use_cases.description: Draft concise best practice notes for onboarding materials.

prompt_templates.title: Fix common Composition API issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Vue 3 component for Composition API issues and list fixes with brief reasoning.

prompt_templates.title: Improve template performance
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the template for v-for and v-if misuse, and suggest a corrected structure.

prompt_templates.title: SSR safety review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this component for SSR unsafe APIs and propose SSR safe alternatives.

prompt_templates.title: TypeScript props and emits audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate props and emits typing for a Vue 3 <script setup> component and propose improvements.

output_examples.input: Check my ProductList.vue for list rendering issues.
output_examples.output: Identifies missing key usage and suggests moving filtering into computed state.

output_examples.input: I need SSR safe access to window in a component.
output_examples.output: Explains how to guard browser only code and recommends onMounted usage.

best_practices: Prefer computed for derived state and keep it side effect free.
Use unique keys for list rendering and avoid v-if with v-for on the same element.
Type props and emits explicitly in <script setup> for clarity.
anti_patterns: Mutating props directly inside child components.
Calling async side effects inside computed or template expressions.
Mixing Options API patterns into Composition API components without need.

faq.question: Does this skill cover Vue 2 Options API?
faq.answer: It focuses on Vue 3 Composition API and covers Options API only when required.

faq.question: Does it generate full components?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but does not scaffold entire projects.

faq.question: Can it validate SSR safety?
faq.answer: It can flag common SSR unsafe patterns and suggest safer alternatives.

faq.question: Will it run tests or build the app?
faq.answer: No, it does not execute code or run build commands.

faq.question: Is it limited to <script setup>?
faq.answer: It prefers <script setup> but can discuss alternatives when needed.

faq.question: Does it enforce a style guide?
faq.answer: It offers best practices but does not replace team specific guidelines.
